messageBody:
Tejal,



This is definitely not the right forum for your question. You should
ask that question on the Log4J user mailing list.



The problem you see here is that Log4j cannot find the properties file.
It usually has to be on the path of your applications. Configuration of
Log4J in a Servlet context is usually accomplished by followint the
pattern to write a dedicated Servlet that takes care of configuring
Log4j during the Servlet bootstrap process of your web app.



The following pages should give you a start:
http://logging.apache.org/log4j/docs/manual.html



Andreas





________________________________

Subject: [junit] log4j problem while unit testing servlet



Hi Friends,

I am unit testing a servlet using cactus.
Everything is set( all required files), but tomcat gives me a warning,
as
follows.

log4j:WARN No appenders could be found for logger
(org.apache.catalina.startup.E
mbedded).
log4j:WARN Please initialize the log4j system properly.

Therefore I came to know that I have to make an entry in my
log4j.properties to set appender for logger.
But I do not know what to add in log4j.properties.

My question is how do I set logger as per the above given warning by
tomcat(in red).

Thanks & Regards,
Tejal Khatri
